CatDescriptText: Cutline of image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, July 17, 1965, pg. 16, reads: "Local Interest - in large cast of 'Porgy and Bess,' currently playing at the Civic Arena, are three area youngsters.  Here they appear to be enjoying comments from Dr. Eva Jessye, who is in charge of the beautiful choral group.  Dr. Jessye is one of the original members of the cast of 1935.  Left to right: Clifton Smith, Youngstown, Ohio; Stephen Pona, Carl Redwood Jr. and Michele Stewart, all of Pittsburgh.  In the rear is former Pittsburgher Irving Barnes, who plays "Robbin," and is an alternate 'Porgy.' - Harris Photo."
TitMainTitle: Dr. Eva Jessye holding "Porgy and Bess" score, surrounded by children, from left: Clifton Smith, Stephen Pona, Carl Redwood Jr., and Michele Stewart, with Irving Barnes in rear, backstage of Civic Arena
